intro: Delissea truncata var. juddii, commonly known as the Judd's delissea, is a rare and striking plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like foliage and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, adding a delicate touch to its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
